[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: bootstrap_async()] [Chain ID String Parsing] Can malformed chain_id strings in the ledger_information response cause parsing errors that panic the server? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: health_check()] [Unbounded Health Checks] Can rapid health check requests with large duration_secs values cause resource exhaustion in the REST client? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Struct: RosettaContext] [Stale Client Reference] If the underlying REST API endpoint changes, does the Arc<Client> automatically update, or can stale connections persist causing incorrect data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Struct: RosettaContext] [Block Cache Staleness] Can the BlockRetriever cache serve stale block data after chain reorganizations, leading to double-spend opportunities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: RosettaContext::new()] [Currency State Inconsistency] Can concurrent modifications to the currencies HashSet during operations cause reads of inconsistent currency configurations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: handle_rejection()] [Error Recovery Loop] Can certain error types trigger infinite retry loops in clients, causing distributed DoS across the network? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: bootstrap_async()] [Panic on Chain Mismatch] The .expect() call will panic the entire thread - can this be exploited to repeatedly crash the Rosetta service? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: health_check()] [Error Propagation] Does the ?operator properly propagate all REST client errors, or can certain error types be silently ignored causing false health status? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: routes()] [Missing Authentication] No authentication mechanism is visible in the routes - can unauthenticated attackers access all Rosetta endpoints including sensitive operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: routes()] [Missing Rate Limiting] No rate limiting is implemented - can attackers flood the API with requests to cause DoS or resource exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: health_check_route()] [Health Check Abuse] Can unauthenticated attackers repeatedly query health checks to probe internal node status or network topology? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: RosettaContext::new()] [Chain ID Collision] Can two different networks have the same chain_id causing transactions to be valid on both chains (replay attack)? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: bootstrap_async()] [Chain ID Integer Overflow] Is the chain_id u8 value properly bounded, or can overflow cause wrapping to unexpected chain IDs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Module: account] [Module Isolation] Can vulnerabilities in the account module leak into lib.rs through the routes integration, bypassing isolation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Struct: RosettaContext] [HashSet Collision] Can hash collision attacks on the currencies HashSet cause performance degradation or incorrect currency lookups? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rosetta/src/lib.rs] [Function: bootstrap_async()] [Async Initialization Race] Can the JoinHandle be dropped before initialization completes, causing incomplete server setup? (Medium)
